definition: profuse perspiration
supreme khan
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
dripping with sweat
Timur or Tamerlane (1336-1405), Mongol emperor and conqueror
brow beaded with sweat/perspiring freely

sentences.english: Usually at this time of the year, Fang should be sweating in the fields.
sentences.chinese: 通常一年中這個時候，方應該在田地裏滿頭大汗的。

sentences.english: My eyes water profusely now, as do my salivary glands.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛水大汗現在一樣，我的唾液腺。

sentences.english: Visible all sweating evil spirits are not sweat, wet disease in particular.
sentences.chinese: 可見凡發汗祛邪都不可使其大汗，溼病尤其如此。

sentences.english: Chen is full of sweat with heat so that he has to untie the buttons of blue shirt.
sentences.chinese: 陳老師熱得滿頭大汗，索性將藍色襯衣的扣子解開。

sentences.english: At the moment of impact, he would wake in a sweat.
sentences.chinese: 在碰撞的瞬間，他會滿身大汗的醒來。

sentences.english: Xiao gang full head big sweat from the river to play water to help young trees watered.
sentences.chinese: 小剛滿頭大汗的從小河邊打來水幫小樹澆水。

sentences.english: Climbs Hou on the Bin face to sweat profusely , the double arm blue vein storm leaves.
sentences.chinese: 攀緣中的侯斌臉上大汗淋漓，雙臂青筋暴出。

sentences.english: He got up on the tree, quite frightened, sweating like a pig.
sentences.chinese: 他爬到了樹頂上，嚇得滿頭大汗。

sentences.english: Recording space, sweat haired Liao accepted the reporter's late-night visit.
sentences.chinese: 錄製間隙，滿頭大汗的廖健接受記者的深夜造訪。
她說，“真讓人大汗淋漓啊。”

sentences.english: Passing by the football field, I saw several boys playing football with sweat covering their faces like rain.
sentences.chinese: 路過足球場，幾個男孩子正在踢球，踢得滿頭大汗。

sentences.english: One day Hong came back home after buying some food and was sweating cats and dogs.
sentences.chinese: 這天洪小玲買菜回來，累得滿頭大汗。

sentences.english: Is sweating profusely , removes the throat to say to the security.
sentences.chinese: 滿頭大汗，撤着嗓子衝着保安說道。

sentences.english: Suddenly the door, "Ziya" A opened, profuse sweating and Song were back.
sentences.chinese: 忽然門“吱呀”一聲開了，宋國人滿頭大汗地回來了。

sentences.english: And he was perspiring with anger and he was very angry and he went.
sentences.chinese: 他因憤怒滿頭大汗，他非常生氣，他就走了。

definition: khan (loanword)
Tolui (1193-1232), fourth son of Genghis Khan
Ögedei Khan (1186-1242), a son of Genghis Khan
Bayan (name)/Bayan of the Baarin (1236-1295), Mongol Yuan general under Khubilai Khan, victorious over the Southern Song 1235-1239/Bayan of the Merkid (-1340), Yuan dynasty general and politician
Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), grandson of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗, first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294
Temujin, birth name of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗[Cheng2 ji2 si1 han2]
Mongolia
Mongol
Chagatai (died 1241), a son of Genghis Khan
khanate (Mongol state)
prince/marquis/nobleman
Muqali or Mukhali (1170-1223), military commander under Genghis Khan 成吉思汗[Cheng2 ji2 si1 han2]
Ögedei Khan (1186-1242), a son of Genghis Khan
Tartar (various northern tribes in ancient China)/Tatar (Turkic ethnic group in central Asia)

Hong Taiji (1592-1643), eighth son of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤, reigned 1626-1636 as Second Khan of Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金, then founded the Qing dynasty 大清 and reigned 1636-1643 as Emperor/posthumous name 清太宗
chanyu (Han Dynasty name for chiefs of Xiongnu Huns 匈奴[Xiong1 nu2])
